alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 11:31AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Douglas and Alpine Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows along the West Fork Carson River and nearby small feeder streams. Peak flows will occur overnight. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...West Fork Carson River At Woodfords. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding in the southwestern Carson Valley between Centerville and Genoa, impacting agricultural areas, local roads, and outbuildings. Impacts will be more significant if heavy rain and/or snowmelt cause significant rises in small creeks draining the east side of the Carson Range below Woodfords. Possible lane closures on Highway 395 north of Stephanie Way if combined with flood flows on the East Fork. Similar peak level to January 2017 event and May 2017 peak snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:20 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 14.0 feet Sunday night. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Water will be swift moving and very cold. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday by 2 PM PDT.
